No matter what I do, it's never enough. Just once, just one fucking time, I want to be enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your only condemnation is self- pity. You have people that care all around you, but you're too blind to see them. If you don't pull yourself together soon, my friend, they soon will all be gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In B&W SLO-MO: Rick stands watching his sons play. The wind blows the leaves of a tree. The boys run further and further out until they are out of sight. Rick calls out to them. Slowly, across the field, three young adults return. Rick is now an old man, hunched over and aged with wrinkles. The three young men walk beside their elderly father, supporting him with each step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick is holding flowers. The boys have an assortment of "instruments" to add a serenade. The music is a mishmash of odd notes that could only be construed as music to a parent's ear. Melanie stands on the front porch, her arms crossed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick wraps his arms around Melanie and pulls her in for a hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Grabbing him by the collar she's torn. Melanie shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to go inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a proud man, sometimes foolish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a long way to go before I could ever be the man you need me to be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I got confused between what I should have done and what I thought was right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I put you on a pedestal and then I knocked you down. It wasn't fair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were more a mother to my boys than they have ever known. You were more a woman to me than I have ever deserved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to make this easy, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (In Mel's ear) I can live my life alone. I can raise my kids alone. I can walk this path alone. I'd much rather do it with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You just don't get it do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're here for you, you selfish prick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - DAYDREAM Melanie lays in bed covering her ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melanie ENTERS the house closing the door behind her. Rick tosses the flowers on the porch, turns and walks away. The boys follow behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Days go by when I lose me. There are nights when I lay in bed and I can hear Zach through the walls. He's crying out for me, and I lay there motionless, wishing I was anyone but me, anywhere but here, thinking that somewhere, sometime, there has to be room for me. But that someday never seems to come. You're dangerous. Loving you means I lose me. And I will never lose let that happen. (MOR E)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) So, don't come knocking on my door, asking for my heart, if you don't have room for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rick falls flat on his face. He lays there motionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick pounds the ground, pulls himself up, dusts himself off and with a determined look starts back up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick and John sit at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does your heart skip a beat when she walks by?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's my best friend... or was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does your heart skip a beat when she walks by?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do your palms sweat when you think about her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does she inspire you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With music and poetry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And is there passion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And have you ever told her this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever told her this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think you should?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It only confuses things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a shrug John drops to one knee in front of Rick.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I think so... I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you think you're in love you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Loving your best friend confuses things? I can't think of a love more lucid. Rick stands to leave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know I'll never forgive you for this, don't you? You had the power and the dream at your fingertips and you're giving it all away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't marry your best friend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you had things all planned out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Affairs of the heart and those of the mind are two different things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not too late, you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go Home, John. Go home and talk to your best friend the way you talk to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rick BURSTS through the front door. His mother appears aghast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick's Father ENTERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick BOLTS out of the house.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I need you to watch the boys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No more excuses. It's time to live life and enjoy our grandkids. (To Rick) Go. The boys will be fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't we just give him money to pay for a baby-sitter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Melanie is working as a waitress. She's pouring coffee when she sees Rick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cup has nearly reached the brim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick reaches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melanie is at the next customer who early awaits a refill, but she doesn't pour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melanie walks off. Rick grabs a cup from a recently vacated table and sets it in front of the patron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick picks up the cup, pulls a lighter from his pocket and runs it several times under the mug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick moves to Melanie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melanie moves on. Rick gives chase. He catches her and spins her around spilling coffee all over the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melanie sets the coffee on a nearby table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What? Not going to use them to try to persuade me with guilt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a son of my own. I know when people are using their kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Customer 2) Excuse us for a moment okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Setting the cup back down.) Quit your bitching.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't believe you came here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't believe you're a waitress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beats chasing around after snot nosed brats all day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you liked my kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, what do the kids need? A babysitter? A surrogate mom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's about me, the selfish prick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Looking at her watch.) You have 15 seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Melanie, there is a grace about you that reminds me how clumsy I am. There is an honesty about you that reminds me how deceitful I can be. There is a beauty in your eyes that reminds me how ugly I've become. There is a kindness in your voice that contradicts my coarseness. There is a glow around you that illuminates my dullness. There is spirit in you that challenges my laziness, but most of all, there is a woman in you, that sparks my desire, a desire to be graceful and honest and beautiful and kind. A desire to be better than I am or ever thought I could be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think my ten seconds are up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think I heard you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I give you my heart will you promise to treat it softly? Kiss it when it hurts? Put it in a box and know that it belongs to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As brutal as that can be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you. I love you, I love you, I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I kind of like you too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rick comes to another plateau and finds Melanie waiting for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick jumps in Melanie's arms. They tumble to the ground under his weight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I never thought you'd make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never thought you'd find me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had to find me first. I hope you plan on walking, cause I'm not sure I can carry you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, how do we do this? The two begin the ascent together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . SMALL SUBURBAN HOME Rick packs his things in boxes. A knock at the door and the room morphs back into the cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick turns around to see the jailer standing at the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If you leave don't ever come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not even on a visit. You're a very ugly man. I'd hate to explain to the other guards why you'd come to visit me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RICK'S PARENT'S HOME Rick's Mom and the boys are playing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I love her the whole universe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you all the whole universe plus one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rick and Melanie walk across the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick walks off leaving Melanie at center stage. She looks around. The faint echo of a Judge's gavel can be heard in the distance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So, this is where it all happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's funny, the tricks the mind can play on you... but the Judge, he sat right over there... and the jury sat right there... and the audience was filled with all these people who didn't really give a shit about me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And they all sat passing judgement on me, not knowing the situation, just staring over their schoolmarm spectacles and pointing their crooked fingers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reveals: Rick, Melanie, the boys, and John sit watching a ball game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pregnant Carrie returns to her seat carrying a box of hotdogs and drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John's POV: A foul ball is screaming in his direction.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The secret of life, Melanie, is to always pay attention...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... always be prepared for what's right around the corner. The CRACK of the bat.
dialogue.name: dialogue
